page.title: 04STAPLEFORD LIBRARY
page.content: The new Stapleford library was opened in November,1983. It is an open-plan building of two storeys, and is proving popular with all sections of the reading community. Besides containing books, the library also has cassettes and records for loan. There are daily newspapers and bus timetables for people to consult. The library has special computers, a television which shows 'Ceefax', and a lift to take the elderly and the handicapped to the upper floor. A special feature is a small play area for young children to use while their parents are choosing books. This, and the pleasant atmosphere have combined to make it very popular.
